title: Flash flooding hits Lincolnshire as heavy rainfall sweeps through county
content: Towns and villages across Lincolnshire have been hit by flash floods after heavy rainfall swept through the county.  Parts of the region were pelted with rain this evening of Saturday, June 2, leaving streets submerged and people unable to get out of their homes.  Leadenham, Lincoln, Spilsby, East Kirkby, Coningsby and Heckington have all been affected - and in Woodhall Spa, sandbags have been brought out to stop water going into people's homes, according to posts on Facebook.  Boston Road in Spilsby has been described as a ‘river’ by locals.  The flash floods come after experts predicted...
